thread.title: IDC celebrates centenary of Gandhi’s freedom movement
thread.title_full: IDC celebrates centenary of Gandhi’s freedom movement | Examiner.com

author: Radhika Pillai
title: IDC celebrates centenary of Gandhi’s freedom movement
text:
IDC celebrates centenary of Gandhi’s freedom movement IDC Mahatma Gandhi launched his freedom movement in 1915, when he returned to India from South Africa. The India Discovery Center ( IDC ) is celebrating this centenary, and Gandhiji’s message of nonviolence, with a slate of events on Friday, Oct. 16, and Saturday, Oct. 17, at Regis College Fine Arts Center in Weston, Mass.
The “weekend of friendship, community building, and reflection on liberty, respect and equality” will begin on Oct. 16 with a photo exhibition that features rare images of Mahatma Gandhi, followed by a screening of Richard Attenborough’s Oscar-winning movie “Gandhi” at 8 p.m. The events on Oct. 17 will include world music and dances at 4 p.m. as well as a keynote address by Prof. Rajmohan Gandhi, grandson of Mahatma Gandhi. Admission to the event is free on both days, but IDC requests attendees to reserve their spots by registering on the organization’s website .
Dedicated to preserving and sharing history, IDC is a 501(c)3 Boston-based nonprofit. The organization is planning a cornerstone project that involves designing and building a Museum and Education Center that showcases the evolution of Indian culture.
